The Thai government and related agencies: such as the Ministry of Commerce, Ministry of Agriculture and Cooperatives, and Food and Drug Administration of Thailand, declared the claim to be a hoax and confirmed that Thai canned products are thoroughly inspected and certified according to international standards.
The claim was debunked by multiple sourc: including the Royal Thai Embassy and the Indonesian Food and Drug Monitoring Agency, stating that there were no credible evidences to support the accusation of canned food being contaminated with HIV.
Scientific evidence and expert opinions: explaining that HIV cannot be transmitted through food, as the virus does not live long outside the human body and is destroyed by heat during cooking and canning processes.
